section_title:
24c01  Transportation in “foreign commerce” or within a territory or
possession.
text:
(a)   For purposes of the application of Sec
13(b)(1), the term “foreign commerce” means commerce, whether such commerce moves
wholly by motor vehicle or partly by motor vehicle and partly by rail, express,
or water: (1) 
Between any place in
the United States and any place in a foreign country, or between places in the
United States through a foreign country; or (2) 
Between any place in
the United States and any place in a Territory or possession of the United
States, insofar as such transportation takes place within the United States; or (3) 
Between places in a
foreign country, or between a place in one foreign country and a place in
another foreign country, insofar as such trans­portation takes place within the
United States. (b)   Transportation within a Territory or
possession of the United States is nonexempt since such transportation is not
included in the definition of interstate or foreign commerce under the Motor
Carrier Act.
html:
(a)   For purposes of the application of Sec 13(b)(1), the term “foreign commerce” means commerce, whether such commerce moves wholly by motor vehicle or partly by motor vehicle and partly by rail, express, or water:

(1)  Between any place in the United States and any place in a foreign country, or between places in the United States through a foreign country; or

(2)  Between any place in the United States and any place in a Territory or possession of the United States, insofar as such transportation takes place within the United States; or

(3)  Between places in a foreign country, or between a place in one foreign country and a place in another foreign country, insofar as such trans­portation takes place within the United States.

(b)   Transportation within a Territory or possession of the United States is nonexempt since such transportation is not included in the definition of interstate or foreign commerce under the Motor Carrier Act.
